questions.question_text: A user needs to set up a cloud environment that can scale up quickly based on resource utilization. Which of the following does the user need to configure?

discussion.content: mAh is a measurement of capacity not how many cells a battery has. A 9 cell 1800 mAh Li-ion battery has the same power reserve as a 6 cell 1800 mAh Li-ion battery. The correct answer here is the 2200 mAh battery would provide longer run time. The important specs for compatibility are voltage and size so you would want it to be the same size and same voltage rating as the original battery.

comments.content: Thank you for the explanation Justin. One question, what is the effect of number of cells in battery perfomance? Thanks

The mAh is battery capacity. Number of cells really doesn't affect battery longevity unless it's more of the same cell.

Having 3 10 gallon tanks in your car or 6 5 gallon tanks both result in having a 30 gallon capacity.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
as more mAh as more capacity

Selected Answer: B
Higher mAh = longer battery capacity

Selected Answer: B
mAh is the key. Use a phone for example and google the uptime based on mAH

The main difference between the two batteries is how long they hold a charge. While charge times vary according to battery quality, computer hardware and use, a 6-cell battery charge commonly lasts two to four hours while a 9-cell battery charge can last from four to seven hours.

questions.question_text:
A user requests a new laptop battery that will yield a longer run time. The user's current battery has the following information printed on it:
14.8V 6-cell 1800mAh lithium ion battery
Which of the following battery specifications will yield a longer run time but still be compatible with the current laptop?

discussion.content: forcing to decrease the quality of the print is something most people would not do because it just looks bad and makes things illegible. depending on the type of document and text size you would need to find a good fit every time to reduce some ink. printing on both sides is a pretty much guarantee save on money on anything that is 2 pages or more
Forced configuration. Both Duplex and Decreased resolution could save money. Ink is more expensive than paper. I am going to choose C.
why not C? Decreasing print resolution (ie. print quality ex.draft) will use less ink = reduce print cost

questions.question_text: A SOHO wants to reduce printing costs. Which of the following forced configurations would BEST accomplish this goal?

discussion.content: Emulator Software can emulate a other hardware: So you can emulate a ARM-Prozessor/Smartphone, install for example Android and test your new software. (Virtual Machines are simulating the same Hardware like the Host is.)
Emulator software allows you to duplicate various OS systems
